data.title: Locals love this place
data.text: Authentic Mexican food and the place is always packed! Awesome cheeseburgers too. This place is a distance from where I live but I make it a point to frequent it because it is delicious

data.title: The locals know what they're doing
data.text:
Thanks to Tripadvisor for leading us to this wonderful diner.  My wife and I were traveling from Carlsbad to White Sands and we needed a good breakfast on the way.  The Good Luck Cafe did not disappoint.

The place was packed with locals, and I'm pretty sure that this was the fastest service I've ever experienced at a diner.  It couldn't have been more than 3 - 4 minutes from order to food on the table, and that was with the restaurant being full.

My wife had the picadillo and eggs (spicy and delicious) and I had the chorizo and eggs.  Both were delicious and the prices can't be beat.  Absolutely worth a visit!

data.title: Best Mom and Pop Diner
data.text: This is one of El Paso's best diners. The food is authentic. If you want traditional Mexican food this is the place. It was voted best menudo.

data.title: Greasy spoon
data.text: Great mexican food.  Had the chili rellenos which were delicious but dripping with grease. Staff were very friendly.  Saturday and sunday mornings are always crowded but worth it if you have to wait. Colorful clientele a plus.

data.title: Passing through
data.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the authenticity and variety. Be advised however, this is a greasy spoon, so if you are looking for something healthy this is probably not for you.

data.title: top rated menudo in el paso
data.text: In town for the weekend of February 5th. Decided to ask a local wheres a good place for breakfast. She directed us to Good Luck Cafe we found the place after a bit of driving from the eastside. The wait was not bad and we were relieved to see locals crowding the place. My bf had the menudo he said it was excellent. I had bacon and eggs it came with some of the best hashbrowns and refried beans i have had and thats saying alot. Had to try a beef taco after seeing some go to another table. WOW! it was so good. I recommend the tacos. Service was great and we had a nice server.We will definitely be going back to this place on our next trip to El Paso!

data.title: Good old fashioned mexican food
data.text: What can I say but excellent food.  Menudo is always a great choice.  Hot and fresh always.  The burgers are superb and their breakfasts are just like home cooking from grandma.  Not one bad thing in the menu and excellent prices.  Then to top it off the staff are friendly and fast.  Highly recommended.

data.title: Excellent Mexican food
data.text: One of my favorite restaurants everything is really good . .its always packed with old Mexican people that's how you know its good

data.title: Awesome way to start your day
data.text:
An EP tradition for breakfast. Serve is fast, friendly and a true slice of El Paso. Food is what you get at a typical Latino home - eggs, Piccadio, tocino (bacon), menudo, papas fritas, frijoles, etc. prices are easy on the wallet 
 
On wknds you will have to wait but you get to mingle and talk with other hungry guests waiting for a table.

A real treat is a seat at the counter!!!

data.title: Looks awefull, tastes like gold!
data.text: An outside look may drive people away but this hole-in-the-wall is some of the most delicious and authentic Mexican food you will get. They may not speak English very well but they are so nice! We had great service and the food was soooo good!!

data.title: Restaurants
data.text: Great  restaurant. Have eaten there many times and the food was always good. The staff is also very friendly. Always very busy on week-ends

data.title: A MUST HAVE
data.text: This restaurant has a variety of Mexican food. They serve menudo all day, and the owners work with the staff and well. It's a very friendly place and the atmosphere is enjoyable

data.title: Must Eat at Good Luck
data.text: This is another great El Paso hole-in-the-wall! You should definitely stop by. Breakfast or lunch - the food is great. Just don't try to eat there on Wednesday - they're closed!

data.title: Just ok
data.text: Tried this restaurant this morning looking for good menudo, but found out it was just ok. Guess I'm use to San Antonio menudo where they bring it with onion, cilantro and tortillas de maiz free of charge.  Here they charge for tortillas to go with your menudo. The worst thing about this place was parking.  It's all street parking and you  have to walk across a busy street. It is open 24 hours. This place was just ok.

data.title: Great Food Low Prices
data.text: Yes it's small but the restaurant is always clean and the service is very pleasant. Had the enchiladas montadas plate, very satisfying.

data.title: Best Food
data.text: Whatever u order u will not b disappointed this is a great cafe i always look forward going there when im down in that  side of town.

data.title: Frequent visit
data.text: I love this place.  I have only eaten here for breakfast and love it.  One day ill try the lunch or dinner.   Great mexican breakfast.   Please dont come for the service.  They do have decent waitresses but i dont come for the service.   Great hole in the wall eating.

data.title: Excellent Food, Local Hotspot
data.text:
My family and I were looking for a place to eat after visiting Chamizal, and this one hit the spot. Expect to stand in line, but not too long, and it's definitely worth it. We had to look up a few things online as the menu just lists the dish names, but I would highly recommend the chile relleno and the chilaquiles.

There was definitely a local flair to the place. Most of the people there were from El Paso. In addition, there were occasionally people wandering through offering things for sale, but they're not pushy, so it just added to the ambience.

data.title: Goodluck
data.text: The posole is great! So are the cheeseburgers and the home made french fries.  Always packed on the weekends for breakfast so plan to wait in line.

data.title: One of the better local breakfast spots in El Paso
data.text:
-Excellent service
-The fare is similar to what you would find in other local Mexican breakfast spots however we found it a step above the rest, for example-they had great side breakfast potatoes and the re-fried beans were not runny, you actually had whole beans mixed in. We went on a Saturday morning and it was crowded, go early or be prepared to wait a bit for seating.
